page.title: 02TOURISM IN BROADWAY
page.content: The village of{Broadway}is often called{'The Gateway to the Cotswolds'. Its delightful main street, lined on either side with mellow stone cottages and shops, is crowded with tourists for much of the year. Hotels and guest houses abound, the most famous hotel being the{Lygon Arms}where visitors may sleep in four-poster beds and sample the delights of a traditional English country inn. The village shopkeepers cater for tourists by offering a wide variety of high quality British made goods. The neighbouring village of{Willersey}is equally delightful with its famous {duckpond.}It too boasts picturesque stone cottages. The lovely church of St. Peters lies hidden from the main road.{Broadway}and{Willersey}are typical Cotswold villages. Traffic congestion is a problem in{Broadway.
